ğŸ”§ Enhance stats management: reset corrupted stats, ensure positive values, and improve fallback mechanisms for track and image counts

Adds consistent hashing mechanism to spread load across nodes (#19)

* Adds initial DDL for the leases table

* Adds restart target for make

* Prepares for the consistent hash ring

* Adds option to set a node name

* Adds an option to set a vnode count

* Adds an option to set a heartbeat interval

* Adds vnode calculation

* Adds rangeLen calculation

* Extracts a Range type

* Prepares for testing the Heartbeat

* Improves the test setup

* Adds more tests of the Heartbeat

* Adds function to insert a lease

* Refactors the Ring.Analyze method

* Introduce a vnodeSet

* Adds a few more edge cases to the heartbeat test

* Fix a wiring issue

* Fix test setup

Thanks for pointing this out. Yes, it seems we will experience a difference in position when we hard reset. Iâ€™ll follow up in this PR thread to reach out to the team leads regarding our decision on handling pending save states, saving only on back navigation, and the expected behavior for the reset functionality.

I think itâ€™s best to focus on one approach for now until we get confirmation from the team, while still keeping the flexibility to pivot if needed. Essentially, we have two options:

1. **Hard reset**
2. **Save only on back navigation**

Iâ€™ll outline thoughts for both so we can quickly pivot after team confirmation:

**If unsaved (do not override immediately):**
* Compute and return the restoration value along with the sync status (ephemerals alone arenâ€™t sufficient).
* Use the restored states to persist values through configuration changes.
* On back navigation:
  * Compare the current value to the reset value.
  * If unchanged (no further manual changes) 
    * perform the removal process now
    * filter and override remaining values in the DB.

**If immediately saved (current implementation):**
- Override and set background/backup values â€” this also serves as an important indicator for hard reset + (on confirmation: removing the reset button itself as an indicator for hard reset).
- Return the restoration value to.
- On back navigation:
  * Compare the value with any manual parameter state changes.
  * If the same, exclude from further overrides.
  * If different (manually changed), it will be overridden as needed.

This could be rough, but we can use to pivot based on the decision. Currently please proceed with how its setup now i.e. considering it as a hard reset + reset the background color as well so fits with other non-overridden parameters when repositioned, I believe as per one of the last suggestions having a separate `isParamOverridden` can be helpful to set the background colors than relying on `isResetAvailable`.

comment.body:
Can we just do

```kotlin
val restoredValue = result.value.first { it.id == id }.currentValue
```

since itâ€™s safe to skip `?: PlatformParameterValue.getDefaultInstance()`? `currentValue` is guaranteed to be non-null, and the restored value should always be present in the list, so using `first { it.id == id }` also makes the code fail-fast if something unexpectedly goes wrong.

This pull request introduces functionality to reset locally overridden platform parameters and feature flags to their server or default values, along with UI updates to support these features.

### New Functionality

#### Platform Parameters
- Added `resetPlatformParameter` method to handle resetting parameters to server/default values
- Integrated reset functionality in presenter with proper state management
- Added UI components for reset button with conditional visibility

#### Feature Flags

- Added consistent reset behavior matching platform parameters
- Integrated with existing feature flag UI components

### UI Updates

- Updated layouts to include reset sections for both platform parameters and feature flags
- Ensured consistent styling and behavior between both reset implementations

### Testing

- Verified reset behavior persists across activity recreation

comment.body:
Following up on the fragment reset save states: 

I find this approach problematic. We should ideally use the restored/fallback details to manage the states. Using `getDefaultInstance` returns defaults like `0` or `false`, which can lead to loss of reset data. When unbound (as it goes back down to its reset position in the list) and compared on back navigation, itâ€™s not yet set to the actual restored value, so it falls back to defaults, gets incorrectly treated as overridden, and reappears as such.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b6f59684-d5db-4016-a1d3-4fe8eaebb9f8

comment.body: This is currently hardcoding every reset fallback status to default, but it should instead retrieve the restored value. Retrieve both the fallback/restored sync status and value to be used here.

pull_request.title: Fixes part of #5345: Implemented Reset functionality of Platform Parameters.
pull_request.body:
Fixes part of #5345:
This pull request introduces functionality to reset locally overridden platform parameters and feature flags to their server or default values, along with UI updates to support these features.

### New Functionality

#### Platform Parameters
- Added `resetPlatformParameter` method to handle resetting parameters to server/default values
- Integrated reset functionality in presenter with proper state management
- Added UI components for reset button with conditional visibility

#### Feature Flags
- Implemented parallel `resetFeatureFlag` method for boolean flags
- Added consistent reset behavior matching platform parameters
- Integrated with existing feature flag UI components

### UI Updates
- Added observable fields to manage reset button state (`isResetAvailable`, `isResetButtonActive`)
- Updated layouts to include reset sections for both platform parameters and feature flags
- Ensured consistent styling and behavior between both reset implementations

### Testing
- Added comprehensive test coverage for both platform parameters and feature flags
- Verified reset behavior persists across activity recreation
- Confirmed proper state management during reset operations

### Screen Recording
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/381a6912-f331-45e4-a266-7e270cac12d2

## Essential Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title and explanation each start with "Fix #bugnum: " (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] Any changes to [scripts/assets](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/tree/develop/scripts/assets) files have their rationale included in the PR explanation.
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary code changes from Android Studio ([reference](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Guidance-on-submitting-a-PR#undo-unnecessary-changes)).
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop" and is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to the appropriate reviewers ([reference](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Guidance-on-submitting-a-PR#clarification-regarding-assignees-and-reviewers-section)).

@@ -64,6 +64,24 @@ class PlatformParameterItemViewModel(
   @ColorInt
   val syncStatusBackgroundColor: Int = retrieveSyncStatusBackgroundColor().toInt()
 
+  /** Indicates whether the reset button should be shown for this parameter. */
+  val isResetAvailable = ObservableField(syncStatus == SyncStatus.LOCAL_OVERRIDE)
+
+  /** Tracks whether the reset button is currently enabled (clickable). */
+  val isResetButtonActive = ObservableField(true)
+
+  /** Message for displaying the sync details of the platform parameter. */
+  var syncDetails = ObservableField(processSyncDetails())
+
+  private fun processSyncDetails(): String {
+    return if (syncStatus == SyncStatus.LOCAL_OVERRIDE)
+      resourceHandler
+        .getStringInLocale(R.string.platform_parameter_currently_overridden_message)
+    else {
+      resourceHandler.getStringInLocale(R.string.platform_parameter_never_synced_message)
+    }
+  }
comment.body:
This currently only handles default and overridden casesâ€”please include handling for server status as well.

1. Preferably use a `when` statement.
2. Add a `TODO` linking to our issue tracker, to properly mention that weâ€™re currently using a filler "synced with the server", and that this will need to be updated once the proto with the required details becomes available.

comment.body: I find it a bit confusing to let the icon rely on something named `isResetAvailable`. Could we instead rename it, or introduce a new one to those that rely on the overridden status, to something clearer like `isOverridden` or `isParamOverridden`?

pull_request.body:
Fixes part of #5345:
This pull request introduces functionality to reset locally overridden platform parameters and feature flags to their server or default values, along with UI updates to support these features.

### New Functionality

#### Platform Parameters
- Added `resetPlatformParameter` method to handle resetting parameters to server/default values
- Integrated reset functionality in presenter with proper state management
- Added UI components for reset button with conditional visibility

#### Feature Flags
- Implemented parallel `resetFeatureFlag` method for boolean flags
- Added consistent reset behavior matching platform parameters
- Integrated with existing feature flag UI components

### UI Updates
- Added observable fields to manage reset button state (`isResetAvailable`, `isResetButtonActive`)
- Updated layouts to include reset sections for both platform parameters and feature flags
- Ensured consistent styling and behavior between both reset implementations

### Testing
- Added comprehensive test coverage for both platform parameters and feature flags
- Verified reset behavior persists across activity recreation
- Confirmed proper state management during reset operations

### Screen Recording

Updates `pandas` from 2.2.3 to 2.3.1
Release notes

Sourced from pandas's releases.

Pandas 2.3.1

We are pleased to announce the release of pandas 2.3.1. This release includes some improvements and fixes to the future string data type (preview feature for the upcoming pandas 3.0). We recommend that all users upgrade to this version.

See the full whatsnew for a list of all the changes. Pandas 2.3.1 supports Python 3.9 and higher.

The release will be available on the conda-forge channel:

conda install pandas --channel conda-forge

Or via PyPI:

python3 -m pip install --upgrade pandas

Please report any issues with the release on the pandas issue tracker.

Thanks to all the contributors who made this release possible.

Pandas 2.3.0

We are pleased to announce the release of pandas 2.3.0. This release includes some new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements. We recommend that all users upgrade to this version.

See the full whatsnew for a list of all the changes. Pandas 2.3.0 supports Python 3.10 and higher.

The release will be available on the defaults and conda-forge channels:

conda install -c conda-forge pandas

Or via PyPI:

python3 -m pip install --upgrade pandas

Please report any issues with the release on the pandas issue tracker.

Thanks to all the contributors who made this release possible.

comment.body:
I believe we should prefer using **`app:srcCompat`** instead of **`android:src`** to load drawables because it provides backward compatibility for vector and other resources. With `android:src`, some drawables may not display properly on older Android versions.

>Ref: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/187341964#comment21

```suggestion
        app:srcCompat="@drawable/ic_alert"
```

comment.body:
Few suggestions to the edit text input dimensions as the sizes of the switch and the input toggles looks a bit mismatched.

```xml
<com.google.android.material.textfield.TextInputLayout
    android:id="@+id/platform_parameter_input_layout"
    style="@style/TextInputLayout"
    android:layout_width="wrap_content"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"  <!-- wrap content here -->
    android:layout_marginStart="8dp"
    android:layout_marginTop="12dp"
    android:layout_marginEnd="20dp">      <!-- end margin -->

    <com.google.android.material.textfield.TextInputEditText
        android:id="@+id/platform_parameter_input_edit_text"
        style="@style/TextInputEditText"
        android:layout_width="64dp" />    <!-- smaller width to balance with switch -->
</com.google.android.material.textfield.TextInputLayout>

```

This keeps the input box width compact (closer in size to the switch), while still allowing enough room for the maximum value length (e.g. 1440). Please double-checking that inputs arenâ€™t getting cut off.

Following up on my previous commentâ€”could you also try a few tweaks and see which works best? On the emulator, the input boxes look a bit larger compared to your screen recording, which makes the item view feel cramped. Since the text input boxes take up most of the itemâ€™s height, maybe reducing their size slightly would help.

- Add `android:paddingVertical="8dp"` to the EditText inside the TextInputLayout.
- We might need to adjust `android:layout_marginTop="12dp"` on the TextInputLayout.

I tested these locally on a Nexus 5X emulator, and it gave a more compact look. Itâ€™d be helpful to check if this works well across devices.

comment.body:
As part of the requirement, both categories (overridden and non-overridden) should be alphabetically ordered within themselves. You can use `sortedWith` to first compare by `LOCAL_OVERRIDE` and then by ID name to achieve this.

Doc ref: https://kotlinlang.org/api/core/kotlin-stdlib/kotlin.collections/sorted-with.html

>One note: in #_1, I would also suggest that we order the parameters/flags so that: (a) all the overridden ones are at the top (easier to act on), and (b) in each category of overridden/not-overridden, the flags / params are sorted alphabetically by name.

review.body:
Thanks, @theayushyadav11, for pushing the logic changes and attaching the screenshots and screen recording â€” those are very helpful. Iâ€™ve taken an initial pass on the newly redesigned version. The major requests are around storing the reset values with their details to handle them properly. The current implementation is missing server sync functionality, and there are a few design-related requests as well.

Iâ€™ve mostly commented on the platform parameter parts, but most of these points also apply to feature flags. I didnâ€™t comment on those separately to avoid duplication, but please make sure the changes are applied there as well. There are also a few comments from the previous review â€” please ensure those are addressed. During cleanup, remove all old design code parts. This might require another pass after the changes, and Iâ€™ll review it fully along with the test changes included in the next push.

Regarding the reset implementation, please PTAL at this comment. Iâ€™ll follow up soon with more details on requesting direction from the team by EOD.

Additionally:
* Please update the PR title and milestone title to reflect that this PR is for the dashboard redesign.
* Include the screenshots and recording in the PR description and keep them up to date so reviewers and code owners can easily refer to them.

issue.body:
<!--
ğŸ‘‹ Hi, thanks for sending a PR to typescript-eslint! ğŸ’–
Please fill out all fields below and make sure each item is true and [x] checked.
Otherwise we may not be able to review your PR.
-->

## PR Checklist

- [x] Addresses an existing open issue: fixes #11223
- [x] That issue was marked as [accepting prs](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22accepting+prs%22)
- [x] Steps in [Contributing](https://typescript-eslint.io/contributing) were taken

## Overview

<!-- Description of what is changed and how the code change does that. -->
### Auto fix & suggest unused import statements
- Test cases that correspond to the issue can be fixed
- add option: `enableAutofixRemoval.imports: boolean` , not enable default

examples
```ts
import Unused1 from 'foo';
import Unused2, { Used } from 'bar';
export { Used };

import { Used } from 'bar';
export { Used };

// -------------------
import { Unused1 } from 'foo';
import Used1, { Unused2 } from 'bar';
import { Used2, Unused3 } from 'baz';
import Used3, { Unused4, Used4 } from 'foobar';
export { Used1, Used2, Used3, Used4 };

import Used1 from 'bar';
import { Used2 } from 'baz';
import Used3, { Used4 } from 'foobar';
export { Used1, Used2, Used3, Used4 };

// -----------------
import { /* cmt */ Unused1, Used1 } from 'foo';
export { Used1 };

import { /* cmt */ Used1 } from 'foo';
export { Used1 };

// ------------------
import type { UnusedType } from 'foo';
import { Used1, Unused1 } from 'foo';
export { Used1 };

import { Used1 } from 'foo';
export { Used1 };

// -----------------
import { Unused1 as u1, Used1 as u2 } from 'foo';
export { u2 };

import { Used1 as u2 } from 'foo';
export { u2 };
```

commits.message:
Move resources

Move resources, so they get included in the distribution package.

use env var for log level

Setting BLUEBIRD_LOGLEVEL=value in the environment will configure the
log level to the given value. Acceptable values are ALL, OFF, INFO,
DEBUG, TRACE, WARN, and ERROR.
Report BLE disconnections to front end

Eliminate deprecation warnings

Use non-deprecated rounding functions.

Allow connect to unpaired device

Connection to unpaired device now works.

LinuxBluezBLE disconnection works

When BLE disconnects, driver detects and reports to front end.

Disconnection UI cleanup

When user initates disconnection, pt robot back into list of available
robots.

Fobot list UI formatting fixes.

Make list rows alternate backgrounds alternate shading (this was
previously attempted in CSS, but was broken, need to use nth-of-type
instead of nth-child in CSS selector). Make the shading a little darker.

Make list a little wider, to avoid excessive line wraps.

Make list rows a little less tall, to avoid excessive whitespace when
there are several robots in list.

Filter available robots list

Don't show robots as available if already connected.

Include dbus modules in distribution

The dbus modules must be runtime-discoverable in the jlink distribution.

Fix jetty so it can serve snap locally

The previous way of configuring the jetty http server to serve the snap-related files doesn't work with a jlink-based distribution. Use a different method which works regardless of distribution type.

Silence more log messages

Add a slf4j-nop dependency, so jetty is quieter.

issue.title: tests/samples: drivers: adc: rework tests filtering and configuration
issue.body:
Make tests/samples and test scenaries depend on the existence of required DT elements (aliases, "zephyr,user" properties...) 
Now that samples/tests are selected automatically depending on platforms DT, I won't be build in CI if the required DT elements are not provided, remove platform_allow/exclude from generic test scenarios.
Add more integration platforms to cover most ADC IPs/drivers.

performed_via_github_app.name: SonarQubeCloud
performed_via_github_app.description:
SonarQube Cloud (formerly SonarCloud) is a SaaS code analysis tool designed to detect coding issues in 30+ languages, frameworks, and IaC platforms. Your code is checked against an extensive set of rules that cover many attributes of code, such as maintainability, reliability, and security issues, on each merge/pull request.

For those requiring US-based hosting, [SonarQube Cloud US](https://sonarqube.us/) offers the perfect alternative. If you need data residency outside the US or within the EU, [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/) with this GitHub app is the ideal solution.

SonarQube Cloud integrates seamlessly into your GitHub workflow and provides clear guidance for resolving any code quality and security issues detected. The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!

With [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:

-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code
    
-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools
    
-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC
    
-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline
    
-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration
    
-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code
    
-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories
    

A [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.

A free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. We also provide a no-commitment, [14-day trial](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/) of SonarQube Cloud Team for unlimited team members, up to 1.9M LoC, AI CodeFix recommendations, and more. No need to speak with a sales rep or request a license key - get automatic code analysis results on your private projects in minutes! Want to see more examples of SonarCloud in action? You can [explore current Open Source projects in SonarCloud](https://sonarcloud.io/explore/projects?sort=-analysis_date) that are using the [Clean as You Code](https://www.sonarsource.com/solutions/our-unique-approach/) methodology.

What are you waiting for? SonarQube Cloud helps you consistently deliver cleaner, secure software that future developers will appreciate and your users will love. Start writing Clean Code. [Now](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/)!
